text:
Hello! Welcome to another Nerdy Nummies! Today
I am dressed as Claudine from

Monster High, because I got so many requests
for something Monster High!

So that is what we’re doing today, we’re
going to make Monster High Cupcakes.

The first thing that we’re gonna do is make
the designs to go on the top.

And that’s because these are going to have
to sit out for 24 hours, so you want

to make these the day before your event or
whatever you want to do.

I printed, online, the little Monster High
skull logos, and then I just

put them all on this piece of paper. There’s
also a really cool website that

you can go, it’s a blog, a baking site,
it’s called Mighty Delighty, I’ll put

a link below so you can go check it out. But
she has pre-made templates that are

really similar to these Monster High ones,
they’re not exact, they have, uh, circles
around them, but, they’re pretty good!

Then you put them down here, and you’re
gonna take a piece of wax paper, and put

it on top. And then you’re gonna tape it
into place.

Then you’re gonna use cookie icing, or it’s
also known as royal icing, so you

can either make it from scratch, or buy the
little cookie icings at the store.

And, I just put all the cookie icing into
this plastic bag, because it has a very

fine, uh, fine point, that’s what you want,
a really small point.

And you’re first gonna trace all of the
black. So, this takes a little bit of time
so just be patient, take your time.

The reason that you want to use royal icing
is because it dries really, really hard,

and that’s what you want. You pick it up
and it’s kind of like a thin chip or cookie.

And we’ll use these different colors, pink,
blue and white, to fill in around
the black lining.

Da-dew! Here are the ones that I made yesterday,
they’re all done, and I would

suggest letting them dry for 24 hours, so
make them the day before you want to bake.

And you’ll also want to leave them in a
very dry area, don’t put them in the

freezer, that, that’s not good for royal
icing. Um, you can either put them in the

oven with just the oven light on, or in a
room with a lot of AC, a lot of

air conditioning. So, yeah! That will dry
them out.

Once they’re done you’re going to add
the eyelashes with gourmet food pens,
these are edible, whoa!

I didn't know that they made these, these
are so cool!
So you take the little black 1, ba-dew!
And we’re just gonna draw on little eyelashes.

When you’re drawing on top of the icing,
just be really, really gentle.

Once these are all done, we’re just gonna
set them aside and we’re gonna make the

last topping. I got these, they’re candy
trays, of vampire lips… Meeeeee!
For Draculaura fang kiss lips!
Haccchhhhh!

You’re gonna take white melted chocolate,
these are just white chocolate melts that

you can buy at the bakery store, put it in
a plastic bag and heat it up.

We’re gonna snip a teeny little… Teeny
little tip, and you’re just gonna fill in
the fangs, haaaccchhhhh!

I had pink chocolate melts, and then melt
them in the microwave and then pour them

into this plastic bag. I tied it off with
a hair tie… Super handy!

Then you’re gonna cut a hole in the bag,
and just fill in the chocolate mold trays.

Make sure you press down, doo-doo-doo-doo-doo-doo-doo!
A lot!
So that it gets all the nooks and crannies!

Right now I’m just tapping it a little bit,
and then I’m gonna, jigga-jigga-jigga…

To help it settle, a lot of times with chocolate
you get little air bubbles, and

that’s OK if you get a few, but, we’ll
try to avoid ‘em!

While those are cooling, I pre-made cupcakes!
These are Strawberry Cupcakes, I’ll

put the recipe down below in the description
if you want to go check ‘em out.

And we are going to frost them with strawberry
frosting.
Now we’re gonna make it rain, with sprinkles!
Done!
Da-nee!

Got all the little pretty cupcakes, and now we’re
gonna take all of the design toppings

that we made, and carefully put them on top,
eeee!
Put our little chocolate kiss lips on!
Ta-da!

Monster High Cupcakes! I really really liked doing
these, it was my first time using royal

icing to do these designs, and it worked so
well! They’re very seamless, so it’s

not like free handing chocolate. Um, this
was amazing.
I think I’m going to do it again! Mmmhmmm!

If you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment and I will do my best to
make it happen!

If you have any spooky ideas, those are my
favorite!
OK, thanks so much, bye-bye!
